notesStmt.note: It seems that a third part was published or at least planned, as it is stated so in the preface. The book ends at 1000AD, which does not make much sense. The first and the second part seems to have been printed in an interval of several months, it may be that the third part should have been printed, but could not because of the upheavals at the time or out of other reasons.

msContents.p: Lemma-organization: The first 2 parts of the book are ordered into 35 juan. Ordered chronologically.
Table of contents: The first part deals with events up to the turn of the eras. The second part deals with events of the 1st millenium AD.
Contents: Historical and cultural events from different countries over the time.

history.p: The 1st part is a reprint of the 1st edition.
A scan of the work is available at the library of the Institute of Chinese Studies, Heidelberg University.

settingDesc.p: The book was at least partly compiled in Shanghai, as its said in the preface.

textDesc.constitution: The first two parts of the book comprise 35 juan. The events therein are ordered chronologically, whereby in the beginning of the column the Chinese way of counting is used and the year related to the Gregorian Calendar is given thereafter in smaller characters. The worldwide events are grouped to each year.
textDesc.purpose: The book should give an overview about Western history and therefore wide the horizon of its readers.
